item.title: Dea-John Reid racially abused before Kingstanding stabbing, say police
item.description: Dea-John Reid, 14, was described by his family as an "incredibly talented young boy".

item.title: Vet drowned with dogs after car became stuck in ford
item.description: An inquest hears Heike Mojay-Sinclare died while driving to a 30th birthday celebration.

item.title: Brixton shooting: Crowds throw objects at police
item.description: Police were targeted after being called out to investigate the shooting of a man in his 20s.

item.title: Sisterhood On Wheels: The women roller-skating in Birmingham
item.description: Sisterhood On Wheels is a group for black women who want to try roller-skating in Birmingham.

item.title: Louth deaths: Tributes paid to mother and son
item.description: Bethany Vincent and nine-year-old Darren Henson were found stabbed to death in Louth on Monday.

item.title: Dalian Atkinson: PC's fear 'through the roof' during arrest
item.description: Murder-accused Benjamin Monk says he thought he and his colleague "were going to die".

item.title: Coronavirus: Pub hires drag queen to enforce rules
item.description: A pub enlists the help of Madam Tess Tickle to ensure drinkers follow coronavirus guidelines.

item.title: Angler fishes unexploded shell from Nottingham river
item.description: Police say the device is believed to have been in the water for "many decades".

item.title: Frank Meadow Sutcliffe: Whitby photographerâ€™s medals auctioned
item.description: Frank Sutcliffe's photographs of Whitby provide a unique insight into 19th Century life in the town.

item.title: Princess Diana's wedding dress going on display at Kensington Palace
item.description: The gown has been loaned to the exhibition by her sons Prince William and Prince Harry.

item.title: Marc Williams: Lewis Ashdown charged with murder
item.description: Lewis Ashdown is to appear in court charged with the murder of Uckfield teenager Marc Williams.

item.title: Huge caterpillar web blankets Yorkshire hedgerow
item.description: The web in South Yorkshire is described by one expert as a "very impressive infestation".

item.title: Covid-19: Could a third wave change 21 June plans in England?
item.description: Rising coronavirus cases have called the planned 21 June relaxing of rules in England into question.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and will they go ahead despite Covid?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics are due to start in July, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Scotland's Covid-19 rules are changing at the weekend - but for many, the lifting of lockdown has been "paused".

item.title: Travel guide to Spain, Portugal, France and more holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about travelling abroad to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or face coverings?
item.description: Rules are relaxing, but masks are still needed in some settings - here's where and why.

item.title: Blocking traffic as a human bollard
item.description: Why some residents in Oxford have taken traffic congestion into their own hands.

item.title: Covid: Duchess of Cambridge dials up surprise for Stockport Spider-Man
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge makes a surprise call to a lockdown superhero to thank him for his efforts.

item.title: Woman receives 'shock' drone Cornwall cliffside proposal
item.description: Lee Parkes said she thought the drone was filming a wedding taking place nearby.

item.title: Covid: Horse therapy for NHS nurse is 'magical'
item.description: Intensive care sister Amanda White, who lost her nephew to the virus, says the therapy "reset" her.

item.title: Lockdown album written by Bungay singer, 16, after cancer diagnosis
item.description: Pearll, who is now in remission, says she saw the spare time as an "opportunity" to record songs.

item.title: Covid: Keep Lancashire's schools closed after half term, says union
item.description: Lancashire has 10 areas in the top 20 worst-affected by coronavirus cases in England.

item.title: Hyde Park stabbing: Teenager stabbed in mass brawl
item.description: The 17-year-old was attacked in front of people who were out enjoying the evening sun.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ticketless Scotland fans asked to stay away from London
item.description: There will be nowhere for fans to gather when Scotland play England at Wembley, Sadiq Khan warns.

item.title: Fishmongers' Hall attack 'looked like pub fight'
item.description: Convicted terrorist Usman Khan fatally stabbed two Cambridge graduates before being shot by police.

item.title: Neal Maupay: Man guilty of Brighton & Hove Albion striker threats
item.description: The conviction over threats to Brighton's Neal Maupay is the first of its kind outside the UK.

item.title: England waiting for Trent Alexander-Arnold update - Gareth Southgate
item.description: England will assess the injury to Trent Alexander-Arnold in the next 24 to 48 hours, says boss Gareth Southgate.

item.title: Antonio Conte: Ex-Chelsea manager clear front runner for Spurs job
item.description: Former Chelsea and Inter Milan boss Antonio Conte emerges as the clear front runner for the vacant Tottenham manager's role.

item.title: Everton: Nuno Espirito Santo and David Moyes emerge as candidates for Toffees job
item.description: Nuno Espirito Santo and David Moyes emerge as two of the leading candidates to become Everton manager.
